Constructors

| Improve this Doc View Source

LoginViewModel()

Initializes a new instance of the LoginViewModel class. This constructor also initializes _userRepository and LoginCommand. _userRepository is constructed as a new instance of UserRepository and LoginCommand is constructed as a new instance of AsyncRelayCommand, passing ExecuteLoginCommand as the execution target and CanExecuteLoginCommand as the execution condition.

Declaration
public LoginViewModel()

| Improve this Doc View Source

CanExecuteLoginCommand()

Determines whether the login command can be executed.

Declaration
public bool CanExecuteLoginCommand()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if the login command can be executed; otherwise, false.
| Improve this Doc View Source

ExecuteLoginCommand(Object)

Executes the login command, validates input, makes a request to authenticate the user, and then sets the user if the authentication is successful. If the authentication or user retrieval is not successful, it stores the response message in an error message.

Declaration
public async Task ExecuteLoginCommand(object obj)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Object obj

The object to execute the login command on. Not actually used in the method.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task

A task representing the asynchronous operation.
| Improve this Doc View Source

ValidateLoginInput()

Validates the login input. It checks if email and password fields are not empty, if email structure is valid, and if the password has the minimum required length.

Declaration
public bool ValidateLoginInput()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean
